Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery ovoid neck-amphora; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of female figure to left (added red peplos with tip of overfall to left of letters), holding a wreath (incised where it overlaps the body, but painted against the background) and lotus flower with long stalk. Trace of figure to right; inscription in field.
Curator's comments: Red inscriptions are rare in Attic black-figure (Beazley and Payne 1929, 262 no. 30). Other examples include British Museum 1861,0425.43 and Tarquinia R.C.5564. LIMC IV, Hera 136A
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.18)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 262, no. 30)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 217, no. B50)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 232, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0018) (Phase 1)
